result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer Lynn Boyle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and or schooling. Absolute sobriety. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be
monitored by random UA's & breathalyzers & community contacts. Any prescription must be taken as prescribed. No drug paraphernalia. AODA and follow through. Do not drive unless properly licensed.

8:23 AM Prosecuting attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jennifer Lynn Boyle in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Castro in court for Jennifer Lynn Boyle. Court Reporter: Saige Smith 

Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea- 21CM1112 Ct 2 GUILTY. 
22CM359 Cts 1 & 3 GUILTY. 
State consents to jury waiver. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: 21CM1112 Ct 2 GUILTY with Cts 1 & 3 dismissed and read in. 22CM359 Cts 1 & 3 GUILTY with Cts 2 & 4 dismissed and read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 22CM359
9 months Racine County Jail imposed and stayed. On each count to run concurrent if revoked. 
1 year probation.

Conditions of probation:
Absolute sobriety. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be
monitored by random UA's & breathalyzers & community contacts. Any prescription must be taken as prescribed. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
No drug paraph.
AODA and follow-through 
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 

Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge
